title: Define Literature Review
text: A literature review is a comprehensive synthesis and analysis of the existing research on a particular topic. It typically highlights gaps in the research, points of consensus, and areas for further investigation.

title: Define Annotated Bibliography
text: An annotated bibliography is a list of citations to books, articles, and documents. Each citation is followed by a brief descriptive and evaluative paragraph, the annotation.

title: Difference Between the Two
text: While both documents summarize research, a literature review synthesizes that information into a cohesive narrative, analyzing the information and drawing conclusions. In contrast, an annotated bibliography provides summaries of each source one at a time, often without analysis.
